trans-unit.source: Use root privileges on Linux virtual machines in Azure
trans-unit.target: Use root privileges on Linux virtual machines in Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use root privileges on a Linux virtual machine in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use root privileges on a Linux virtual machine in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Using root privileges on Linux virtual machines in Azure
trans-unit.target: Using root privileges on Linux virtual machines in Azure

trans-unit.source: By default, the root user is disabled on Linux virtual machines in Azure.
trans-unit.target: By default, the root user is disabled on Linux virtual machines in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Users can run commands with elevated privileges by using the sudo command.
trans-unit.target: Users can run commands with elevated privileges by using the sudo command.

trans-unit.source: However, the experience may vary depending on how the system was provisioned.
trans-unit.target: However, the experience may vary depending on how the system was provisioned.

trans-unit.source: SSH key and password OR password only - the virtual machine was provisioned with either a certificate (.CER file) or SSH key as well as a password, or just a user name and password.
trans-unit.target: SSH key and password OR password only - the virtual machine was provisioned with either a certificate (.CER file) or SSH key as well as a password, or just a user name and password.

trans-unit.source: In this case sudo will prompt for the user's password before executing the command.
trans-unit.target: In this case sudo will prompt for the user's password before executing the command.

trans-unit.source: SSH key only - the virtual machine was provisioned with a certificate (.cer or .pem file) or SSH key, but no password.
trans-unit.target: SSH key only - the virtual machine was provisioned with a certificate (.cer or .pem file) or SSH key, but no password.

trans-unit.source: In this case sudo will not prompt for the user's password before executing the command.
trans-unit.target: In this case sudo will not prompt for the user's password before executing the command.

trans-unit.source: SSH Key and Password, or Password Only
trans-unit.target: SSH Key and Password, or Password Only

trans-unit.source: Log into the Linux virtual machine using SSH key or password authentication, then run commands using sudo, for example:
trans-unit.target: Log into the Linux virtual machine using SSH key or password authentication, then run commands using sudo, for example:

trans-unit.source: In this case the user will be prompted for a password.
trans-unit.target: In this case the user will be prompted for a password.

trans-unit.source: After entering the password sudo will run the command with root privileges.
trans-unit.target: After entering the password sudo will run the command with root privileges.

trans-unit.source: You can also enable passwordless sudo by editing the /etc/sudoers.d/waagent file, for example:
trans-unit.target: You can also enable passwordless sudo by editing the /etc/sudoers.d/waagent file, for example:

trans-unit.source: This change will allow for passwordless sudo by the user "azureuser".
trans-unit.target: This change will allow for passwordless sudo by the user "azureuser".

trans-unit.source: Log into the Linux virtual machine using SSH key authentication, then run commands using sudo, for example:
trans-unit.target: Log into the Linux virtual machine using SSH key authentication, then run commands using sudo, for example:

trans-unit.source: In this case the user will not be prompted for a password. After pressing , sudo will run the command with root privileges.
trans-unit.target: In this case the user will not be prompted for a password. After pressing , sudo will run the command with root privileges.
